span.font: Servicing students from 30 New Hampshire districts and Northern Massachusetts.

h2.font: GSAA will be closed for the remainder of the 2020 school year under the direction or the Governor's office and the NH Department of Education We will be conducting remote learning.

div.h2: A message to prospective students and their Families
What is Granite State Arts Academy?

img.style: margin-top: 5px; margin-bottom: 10px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 10px; border-width:0; max-width:100%

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

div.font:
Because charter schools in New Hampshire are funded at a lower level than traditional public schools, they must make up the difference in funding themselves. This means that GSAA depends on donations, annual family contributions, fundraising, and volunteers to survive.
GSAA is a 501(c)3 tax exempt not-for-profit organization. Monetary contributions are tax deductible.
Your generous contributions help keep our doors open and allow us to continue to offer a strong educational alternative to New Hampshire families.
Thank you so much for your support!

span.span:
With PayPal you can now set your donations
to be recurring every month!

input.name: submit
input.alt: PayPal - The safer, easier way to pay online!

h2.font:
Thank you to the sponsors of our
6th Annual Gala fundraiser

span.span: GSAA nurtures creative thinkers, active citizens and independent learners

with a curriculum that integrates the arts and academics.
Our Vision is a high school that is dedicated to the arts. It appeals to a broad cross section of students who look to discover the joy and transformational power of the arts and are interested in pursuing the arts in a professional setting. Our academic courses instill a sincere lifelong desire to learn.
Students explore real world problems, simultaneously developing cross-curriculum skills while working in small collaborative groups. During their time at GSAA students attend art classes each day and study at least two of the following disciplines: Dance, Music, Theater, and Visual Arts. This allows for personalized learning, creating conditions where students’ talents can flourish. This positive approach to educating empowers students to dream and create everyday.

font.font: A rigorous academic curriculum that provides an excellent base for future educational endeavors while encouraging students to explore the world around them.

span.span: In addition to the academic curriculum and art focuses, students learn valuable skills that will prepare them to succeed in any field of study.

span.a: Dance, Music, Theater, Visual Arts, and intensive core curriculum project based learning bringing out the potential in every student.

div.em: All GSAA Board meetings are open to the public and all are welcome who have an interest in our school. Public comments will be limited to the evenings agenda and no items can be added to an agenda at any given meeting. If you wish the Board to consider adding an agenda item to a future meeting agenda please submit a topic request to the Board Chairman, Don Erdbrink at d.erdbrink@gsaanh.com, for review. Please include a phone number where you can be reached.

span.span: Our board consists of business professionals, community leaders, artists, educators, and interested parents.
